activities: Morning: Visit de Young Museum – Fine Arts Museum

📍 Why it fits: Extensive fine arts collection with major exhibitions planned in 2025 such as *Paul McCartney Photographs 1963–64: Eyes of the Storm* (March onward) and contemporary works by artists like Isaac Julien and Rose B. Simpson. Located in Golden Gate Park, it offers a cultural and natural experience.

attractions.name: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMOMA) – Museum/Art Gallery
attractions.address: Address: 151 Third St, San Francisco, CA 94103
attractions.price: General admission $25; discounted rates for seniors, students, youth. Ruth Asawa: Retrospective has a surcharge (estimated +$5).

attractions.name: Legion of Honor – Fine Arts Museum
attractions.price: $20 general; special exhibitions like *Wayne Thiebaud: Art Comes from Art* require additional tickets (~$10–$15).

attractions.name: de Young Museum – Fine Arts Museum
attractions.description: - Address: 50 Hagiwara Tea Garden Dr, San Francisco, CA 94118 (Golden Gate Park)
attractions.price: $15 general; special exhibitions may have surcharges (e.g., Paul McCartney Photography opening March 2025).
attractions.address: Why it fits: Extensive fine arts collection with major exhibitions planned in 2025 such as *Paul McCartney Photographs 1963–64: Eyes of the Storm* (March onward) and contemporary works by artists like Isaac Julien and Rose B. Simpson. Located in Golden Gate Park, it offers a cultural and natural experience.

attractions.name: The Walt Disney Family Museum – Cultural Museum
attractions.address: Address: 104 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94129
attractions.price: $25 general; discounts for seniors and youth

attractions.name: Ferry Building Marketplace – Food Market/Culinary Experience
attractions.description: - Address: 1 Ferry Building, San Francisco, CA 94111
attractions.hours: Market stalls usually open 10:00 AM–6:00 PM (some open earlier for breakfast)

attractions.name: Asian Art Museum – Museum
attractions.address: Address: 200 Larkin St, San Francisco, CA 94102
attractions.price: $20 general; discounts for seniors, youth, and students

attractions.name: Metropolitan Museum of Art
attractions.description: One of the world's largest and most important art museums

attractions.name: Central Park
attractions.description: 843-acre green oasis in the heart of Manhattan

attractions.name: Empire State Building
attractions.description: Iconic Art Deco skyscraper with observation decks

attractions.name: Brooklyn Bridge
attractions.description: Historic bridge connecting Manhattan and Brooklyn

shopping.name: Chelsea Market
shopping.description: Food hall and shopping in former factory

walking.tip: Manhattan is very walkable, especially Midtown

local_tips: Tipping: 18-20% at restaurants, $1-2 per drink at bars
Weather: Check forecast daily, layers recommended
Safety: Stay aware in crowded areas, keep valuables secure
Best views: Top of the Rock, One World Observatory, Brooklyn Bridge
Free WiFi: Available at most cafes, libraries, and parks
Happy hours: Many bars offer deals 4-7 PM on weekdays
Museum free hours: Many museums have free or pay-what-you-wish hours
Broadway tickets: Try lottery or rush tickets for discounts
